posts.post_content:
5 mana, for a 5/5 flyer is decent enough, especially when one of those colors is ![Green](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=G&type=symbol). Then you add the sac ability, and hexproof to it and this is one incredible legendary creature! I pulled this in my pre-release packs and based my deck around it. I never got to use it, but since my opponent was playing black the first round, would've been game changing had I been able to.
  
   
I may change my [thrun](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=thrun) around and make this the commander with hexproof stuff, or I may put it into [Uril](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Uril) for some enchantment beatdown.

Posted By: Fenix. (5/1/2012 9:25:11 AM)

posts.post_content:
Too powerful, I don't like it. Her abilities narrow the range of stuff that can kill her so much that she'll be format warping on her own. It'll certainly keep [Phyrexian Metamorph](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Phyrexian Metamorph) and [Phantasmal Image](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Phantasmal Image)'s prices pretty high and it will probably bring [Day of Judgement](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Day of Judgement) back into style quick smart.  
  
At least with Thrun (also not a fun card) you could fly over him or outsize him with a defender. Sigardia is going to remain relevant for the whole game, either hitting you or blocking.

Posted By: PinkleDadandy (5/14/2012 10:04:28 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
A great follow-up move to an already enchanted, lesser creature. There's no fear of targeted removal. She has a large enough body to dominate in aerial combat for quite a while even without buffs, assuming you get her out around turn five. She's an excellent backup creature to enchant should anything happen to your already-existing one, which she helps keep alive with her 3rd ability. Slap something like [Boar Umbra](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Boar Umbra) or [Indestructibility](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Indestructibility) on her and even fieldwipe can't stop her.   
  
One of ![Green](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=G&type=symbol)![White](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=W&type=symbol)'s best answers to aggressive removal. I absolutely love her.   
  
5/5
posts.html:
A great follow-up move to an already enchanted, lesser creature. There's no fear of targeted removal. She has a large enough body to dominate in aerial combat for quite a while even without buffs, assuming you get her out around turn five. She's an excellent backup creature to enchant should anything happen to your already-existing one, which she helps keep alive with her 3rd ability. Slap something like Boar Umbra or Indestructibility on her and even fieldwipe can't stop her.

One of 's best answers to aggressive removal. I absolutely love her.

5/5

Posted By: CaptainBlue (6/15/2013 3:03:47 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
5/5  
  
This card is so ridiculous.  
  
I run her as my Commander and nobody wants to play against that deck anymore. Of course there are solutions to her; it would be pretty stupid if Wizards made a card with no answers. However, those answers are frustratingly rare. She dies essentially to board wipes, legend rule, and blockers. By my understanding the legend rule is changing, so that really leaves board wipes and blockers.  
  
Which is why her Commander deck is stuff with regenerate, totem armor, and other means of saving Sigarda. Once she sticks she just needs some power-ups to end games quickly.
posts.html:
5/5

This card is so ridiculous.

By my understanding the legend rule is changing, so that really leaves board wipes and blockers.

posts.post_content:
@J\_mindfingerpainter: You'd need 12 mana just to get Blightsteel out. And then white has tons of exiles ([Unmake](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Unmake), [Swords to Plowshares](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Swords to Plowshares), [Path to Exile](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Path to Exile)) as well as Avacyn. If the guy has 8 mana out he'll easily have enough mana to put a creature down then exile Blightsteel. Plus what guarantee do you have that you'll draw Blightsteel when you need it? Sure, the creature's great once you get it out but there are tons of answers to Blightsteel and the biggest drawback is it costs 12 mana. All cards have weaknesses or magic wouldnt work.  
Heck you can even [Tragic Slip](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Tragic Slip) Blightsteel for one mana.

Posted By: brmajor (3/6/2013 2:55:38 PM)

posts.post_content:
@StoicChampion  
  
Back to the drawing board. Assuming you only have one Iona out (e.g., no [Mirror Gallery](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mirror Gallery)), we'll say that whatever color you've blocked, we have a card of a different color to play. In that case, some cards to deal with your situation include:  
  
[Martyr's Cry](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Martyr's Cry) - This removes all of your creatures and enables us to play cards with costs greater than four the next turn, such as [Anarchy](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Anarchy) to wipe out the enchantments (assuming you've blocked red with Iona and we're playing a Red/White deck against you).  
  
[Bane of the Living](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Bane of the Living) - Kills your creatures and gets around Gaddock Teeg. You could prevent this with a [Melira, Sylvok Outcast](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Melira, Sylvok Outcast) out though.  
  
[Arena of the Ancients](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Arena of the Ancients) + [Angel's Trumpet](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Angel's Trumpet) - This would slowly kill you, but since you're running white, I'd probably assume you have some artifact removal. Nonetheless, it is two cards that lock down ... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
